definition[0]: if a situation or person is tainted by something, it damages them by making them seem bad
example[0]: Baker argues that his trial was tainted by negative publicity.
definition[1]: to damage something by adding an unwanted substance to it
example[1]: The water had been tainted with a deadly toxin.
definition[2]: the appearance of being related to something bad or morally wrong
example[2]: The city has suffered for many years under the taint of corruption.
